theres a couple of things you can do, the easiest is to edit ~/.vimrc and add: "color: murphy"
replacing murphy with your preferred color scheme :)
ty
where do u add them
just anywhere in that file is fine
you may also want to add: :syn on, for syntax highlighting
where do u add new themes
ty
you want to add a new theme? somewhere in .vim :)
~/.vim - I think.

I personally find the defaults to be more than adequate (theres is a lot)
yes, just create it
ty
in vim; if you type <esc> :color <tab>, pressing the <tab> key will go through them all :)
and my config line was wrong, its ":color murphy"
